questionList.qu: A bike travels at 5m/s for 40 minutes. What distance does it travel in km?
A car travels 400km in 5.00 hours. How fast is it travelling in m/s?
A plane travels 8 400km at 200m/s How many minutes will the flight take to the nearest minute?
questionList.solution: 700 minutes. Pay attention to unit conversions.

questionList.qu: A car travels at 20m/s for 1 hour. What distance does it travel in cm?
A ship travels 300km in 18.00 hours. How fast is it travelling in m/s?
A supersonic jet travels 7 600km at 500m/s How many hours will the flight take? (round to the nearest hour)
questionList.solution: 4 hours. Pay attention to unit conversions.

questionList.qu: Plane A travels 14 000km at 960km/h. Plane B travels 13 500km at 920km/h. How much earlier will Plane B arrive to the nearest minute?
questionList.solution: 5 minutes. Find the difference in times.

questionList.qu: Car A travels at 60km/h and starts 20 meters after the starting line. Car B travels at 85km/h and starts at the starting line. Assuming there is constant velocity from each vehicle's start, to the nearest second, how much time separation will there be between both cars when they cross the finish line, 1000m from the starting line?
questionList.solution: 16 seconds. Apply v=d/t formula and find the difference in times. Watch for unit conversions.
